results.description:
Sistagirls a group for women (20s & 30's+) who simply want to get together with other women to have fun, laugh, and of course build lasting friendships. We aim to bring together fabulous, fierce women for networking and friendships; to be a sisterhood where we support one another in every aspect of life. Our goal is to create empowerment & lasting relationships for members all while having fun. Meetups will include night and day parties, brunches, dinners, museums, shopping, networking, game night, getaways, community service, potlucks, movie-nights, and anything else that seems interesting or fun. Don’t be afraid to suggest an awesome meetup!

Men are not allowed in the group, however sistagirls of all races, ethnicities, and cultures we welcome with open arms!
results.name: Sistagirls NYC

results.description:
This group is dedicated to everyone and anyone who has tried to lose weight, has gotten stuck with emotional attachments towards food, has difficulty establishing "healthy" diets, and is looking to gain support from a community on a path similar to theirs. Weight Loss & Wisdom is a supportive community created by an individual who faced the above circumstances.

The Meetup events will always be different. From hikes and outdoor activities to informational lectures by key speakers on health and nutrition within the community. There will be plenty of variety.

If your looking to reach your goals, gain lifestyle mastery, and experience true growth, look no further because this is the group for you.
results.name: Weight Loss & Wisdom

results.description:
For those who are touched by cancer. Whether yourself, a loved one or friend has been affected by cancer we are here to offer a place where healing can cultivate from within. By sharing experiences, stories, and therapies we will expand our knowledge and connectedness to help grow and heal. The goals we have in mind are to grow in Vitality, Community, Mindfulness, Knowledge and HOPE.
We would like to provide weekly showings of the documentary series: The Truth About Cancer. Followed by discussion and sharing. With special hosts touching upon nutrition, alkalinity, foundational healing, meditation, rebounding, essential oils, stretching and yoga. Any suggestions are welcomed.
results.name: Alternative Healing Space for cancer in Little Falls

topics.name: A Course in Miracles Study Group

results.description: The Little Garden is a beginners study group of A Course In Miracles dedicated to recognizing our relationship with god through one another. Our format is structured to introduce and apply the principles and methods of A Course In Miracles in our daily lives. To uncover the principles, we study portions of the text. To apply them, we practice workbook lessons. Each week, we meditate using a workbook lesson, and then study a principle or a workbook lesson, alternating between text and lessons. We also invite students to speak on their experience with a lesson or principle, focusing on a Miracle or Miracles they have experienced. There is no fee to attend; however, a contribution to support the cost of the group is appreciated.
results.name: ACIM -The Little Garden Study Group

results.description:
A crisis continues today in both the New York Courts as well as in the legal services provider community! Thousands of Civil and Supreme Court litigants continue to be unable to find or afford counsel and must appear pro se, without the competency to represent themselves. Moreover, the pro bono legal services provider community is unable to handle the enormous volume of litigants seeking representation. That this shortage of staffing is occurring at the same time that thousands of lawyers are unemployed deserves attention and a solution. Therefore, in order to help address the above structural representation and employment challenges,

917Lawyers Is creating and furthering a community of legal professionals for the purpose of organizing networking meet-ups to enabler participants to discover new public service, pro bono, and career opportunities. At these professionals’ only meet-ups, members will benefit from face to face networking with peers, expanding law firms and legal services providers, and gain knowledge and insight into future
employment as well as pro bono opportunities.

917Lawyers welcomes your thoughts and suggestions by email, and wishes success to all!
results.name: 917LAWYERS CAREER & EMPLOYMENT NETWORK

results.description:
It's been proven that starting a healthy life change as part of a team will often result in better results than eating healthy and exercising alone.
So why not start with joining me next Saturday for a run/walk around Prospect Park. Start off early, get it out the way to begin the rest of your day feeling accomplished and stronger. Bring a friend(s) let’s do this together. I see so many of us on Facebook trying to get our health back by eating better, let’s get off the coach and do the same with exercise.
No excuses, make time for you and your health. Need incentive pretend your boss, your Pastor, your Bishop or mama and papa asked you to be there promptly at 8AM, whoever motivates you to do what you need to do to be there then by all means pretend. Lol

Lets go people See you there!
results.name: New York Running For You Meetup

results.description: In the Hoboken/ Hudson area looking for a place to make paper crafts, express yourself, and make new friends all at the same time? This is the meet up for you! In a laid back environment, I will teach you different paper crafting techniques, from decorating notebooks, to making gift tags, greeting cards, and more! Come for the crafts, stay for a fun time!
results.name: The Flourishing Crafters

results.description:
Our team doesn't teach real estate investing we Create Real Estate Investors. We offer Free Meetings, and Real Estate Investing Training CLASSES that cost, and have helped people transition from Wanting to invest, to BECOMING Real Estate Investors. From an investor that is only making a little extra money and still working for someone else, to a SUCCESSFUL Real Estate Investor who is in charge of how much he or she makes and has the option to never work for anyone else ever again. 

In the big picture we are a National Network of Experienced Real Estate, Agents, Contractors and Tax and Legal Professionals that have been doubling in size every year since 2011. We have programs for Beginners as well as Experienced Investors, in NY, NJ, CT, as well as 27+ locations around the country.

Right now we're in a once in a lifetime buyer's market which is helping to fuel our expansion. When else in our Lifetime, will we see the combination of Below Market property values and Record Low mortgage rates. Working with us will give you the option of Investing Part Time for residual income or Quitting your Day Job, Firing Your Boss and becoming a Full Time Investor. Did you know that there were more Millionaires created through Real Estate than in any other industry? Fortune Magazine has predicted that between 2006 and 2016 10,000 Millionaires will be created because of the recession. Our Goal is to do as much as we can to make that prediction come to fruition. Will You be one of those Millionaires?
results.name: NYC Wholesaling Real Estate Investors

results.description:
A member led group of young, New York based professionals dedicated to supporting entrepreneurs that disrupt the status quo. Though each makes his or her own investment decisions, our members collaborate on investment review and due diligence and pool our funds to provide meaningful capital. Members understand risk and reward in early stage investing are positively correlated and take a long term view on any potential returns.

Our members:
*Are accredited investors under Rule 501 of the Securities Act
*Are eager to provide mentorship to entrepreneurs, particularly those in our peer group
*Actively engage in networking opportunities with both entrepreneurs and angel investors
*Provide expertise from broad networks with diverse backgrounds in a variety of industries
*Agree to make at least one investment per calendar year

Seek out new members in their personal network with experience and resources in marketing, sales, operations, accounting, real estate finance, entrepreneurship and leadership
results.name: NY Hedge Fund Technology, Crownfunding & Developers Group

results.description:
I'm starting this group for parents, like me, who have struggled to find play dates and social skills groups for our ADHD children. I have wished for a judgement free zone, where my ADHD/ODD son can interact with other children and work on his social skills.
I often see parents in similar situations, yet I'm shy to approach them because I don't want to jump to conclusions, or impose on someone who may still be struggling with the diagnosis. If you have a similar interest, please join my group and lets discuss logistics.
results.name: North Jersey Families of Children who have ADD/ADHD Meetup

results.description:
This is a group for women with child/ren to meet up and connect with other parents who understand, appreciate, and want to share info and have lots of fun. As a parent it is not possible to hangout and do all the other single life fun with your single friends as much or anymore. We sometimes feel left out a bit from the outside life, we love our families but we need a little bit of us women time from time to time. We will serve as a support system for eachother. From our passions, hobbies, life goal, professions, life, and parenting. Every voice counts, and we will have group discussions on what we would like to see happen next.

This group is a group to come out with the kids and have playdates and activities for the kids, and fun family activies while the grown ups catch up on life, and socialized. Family beach day, mother and child activities, yoga, cooking class, dancing, women spa day and or retreat. Also for the moms to go out with other moms and have a girls night. Go out dancing, bowling, eat out, or have couple's night out. Make new and/ or experienced mom friends, share tips, info, best doctors, daycare, school, acties or just have someone to talk to. Anyone can request or submit information on free or low cost event that would interest the group.

Professional moms, stay at home moms, single mothers, and everyone is welcome. Have a fitness buddy to lose some baby weight, make a best-friend, find a good sitter and vice versa. Moms with children same age group. Learn a new language, culture, best diet remedy, and best place to shop for discount.  Have women night out, couples night out, and single mingle events for single parents, and We will do everything and anything, members are welcomed with suggestions, and takes turn on planning activities. We are moms but have other part of life as well, have another working mom friend, a single mom friend, and etc.

So welcome to Motherhood retreat!

results.description:

If you want to invest, it takes a lot of time, a lot of knowledge, and nerves of steel to weather the ups and downs of the market. Until now! Learn from successful market experts with over 40 years experience. Come join my team and I with an open mind and hunger to change your financial future. This FREE event is open to everyone, however we do have a limited number of seats, so please make sure you RSVP. Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Back in 1996, we were excited when we could only find a product in a web store, put it into the cart and have it delivered to our doorsteps. A few years forward, customer reviews and social sharing features made shopping already a lot more fun. Entering the Web 3.0 era, commerce is increasingly melting with content, community and context to create never seen before personal shopping experiences.

With the help of new technology, merchants and brands can analyze their customers’ characteristics and behaviours to engage with them within the context of their needs, desires, preferences, timing and location, to surprise and delight them and build long-lasting customer relationships.

The upcoming ecomhack New York is all about how smartphones, wearables, beacons and other emerging devices enable creating these personal experiences that make shopping more individual, more efficient – and more fun.
results.name: ecomhack New York

results.description: Righteous Bite NYC is a dining club designed for the adventurous foodie of color. results.description:
An open mind, a willing heart, and a desire to want something *more* in life is all you need to join us!

I'll be sharing my own personal journey to Freedom and encouraging group discussion as we meet new Fearless friends and support each other in pursuing our goals and dreams!  

I invite YOU to come learn one of the key concepts and self-empowering tools of Fearless Living - a skill that can be used to master emotional Fear in any situation!  We'll also be discussing the way Fear keeps us 'stuck' and learning how to recognize when Fear is actually a marker for growth and opportunity - AND how we can use it to get the things we want!
results.name: Do YOU want to be Fearless?

results.description:
Meet professionals that can help grow your business. Only one professional per business category in BNI chapters. Members generate referrals for each other every week. There is a $25 fee for guests which includes full participation in the group and a hot breakfast.
We are specifically looking for a:
CPA, Architect, Contractor, Photographer, Event Planner

To check for overlaps in professions, click on the link below:

http://manhattanbni.com/ny-manhattan-manhattan-20---people,-passion-&-profit/chapter_members.php
results.name: BNI Chapter 20, People, Passion, and PROFIT

results.description:
Welcome to the Manhattan International Netball Club, and to playing netball in New York! The Club was established in 2000 by women with a love of netball and a desire to build a network for others who also enjoy the game. The Club membership has grown ten-fold since it was formed and continues to grow rapidly, made up predominantly of fun-loving professional women from overseas – with an emphasis on the fun!

MINC caters to competitive and social players. The Club runs weekly practices in Manhattan and regularly fields three teams at local or national tournaments. The aim of the Club is to allow those who participate at a high level achieve their full potential, while also recognizing that the Club provides a strong social network for its members. It balances these aims by having committees focused on coaching and development, as well as committees focused upon social events.

We welcome players of all abilities at all times of the year, so what are you waiting for? Contact our membership secretary, Sue, and come and try it out!
results.name: Manhattan International Netball Club

results.description:
Hey, nonprofit & startup professionals! Let's face it, looks matter. Whether you're in search of a prospective donor or client, you need to follow best design practices to be both noticed and understood. We're founded on the simple philosophy that design needs to be considered now so you'll have a more consistent brand later. But, we get that it might not make sense to take on a huge branding project before you have the funds or knowledge of your brand to back it up. That's where we come in.

We'll give you industry-tailored tools to follow simple design practices now at a rate you can afford. (We can tackle the big branding stuff later.) It's time for smart design to meet smart business.

It's our hope that in addition to connecting you with our classes, this meetup can serve as a discussion about local resources and tools, from printers and design tools to foundation funding and incubators.
results.name: Spark: Design Education for Startups & Nonprofits

results.description:
If you're a woman career professional, a mom transitioning back into the workforce or a mom who needs support to balance work and life, a woman entrepreneur who's juggling just about all she can juggle... or a woman who simply wants to experience support and empowerment through coaching, join the NY/NJ Echoes Coaching Circle Meetup!

EchoesTM Coaching Circles are Directed by the group and the Facilitator in a way that is helpful to each individual. Each circle is:

• A space for learning about yourself within the context of a group and/or a team
• A space to gather relevant information about your own approach to different situations by receiving feedback from circle members
• A space to tackle hard decisions, challenging situations, and gain varying perspectives from others 
• A space to be encouraged to take steps in scary situations
• A space to obtain tools on how to communicate better through role playing and other activities 
• A space to learn techniques to transfer into your life across the spheres
• A space to decompose and recompose the emotionality behind your approach to different situations and to understand how to manage this emotionality and use it to your advantage
• A space to develop a keen understanding about boundaries and the relevance of saying “No” or “Yes”
• A space to fine-tune verbal and gestural expression, and to become comfortable with being a consummate communicator
results.name: NY/NJ Echoes Coaching Circle Meetup

results.description: Meetup Pro puts the power of Meetup to work for your organization. Businesses use Meetup to educate and inspire their communities, drive engagement, and build real relationships with members at the local level. Meetup Pro organizers build chapters of branded Meetups, and appoint local leadership teams to run things on the ground in each city. This Meetup is intended to connect Meetup Pro organizers in New York to share ideas, support one another, and have fun.

I can watch whatever I want on T.V.) and the struggles (ohh...the holidays are here again) of being single.  We will get together to vent, laugh, support, and honor each other's journey. topics.name: Break-up Recovery: Moving On after the Break
Separation & Divorce Support for Men and Women

results.description:
Divorce is one of the most emotionally difficult experiences you will face. We all need support, encouragement and something to look forward to as we go through these challenging times. This group is designed to work with men and women considering divorce, in the midst of the process or post divorced who are seeking support and guidance to move forward.

In each session, you will find support and validation, be coached through your fears and guided to overcome your obstacles; and challenged to set new goals to begin to move forward. You will develop a community of friends who share your struggles and understand your pain and dreams.

We will be consistently inviting and encouraging you to embark on a journey of surviving, discovering, embracing, dreaming and living full out.
results.name: Journey Beyond Divorce - Bergen Rockland

results.description:

Doors open at 6pm, Film rolls at 7:30pm. Transgender people, their friends and lovers are welcome to this free event at the CDI Empowerment center on West 47th Street. 

CDI is a social and support organization that was founded 25 years ago.  It's mission is to help Cross Gender individuals to develop their feminine presentation and mannerisms in a safe, supportive, nonjudgmental group environment.

Event attendance is limited to 25 people.

results.description:
Improve Your Acting Technique and Character-Building Skills Using a Psychological Perspective

This is a workshop for actors, screenwriters, filmmakers, and performing artists who wish to gain psychological insights to improve their character-building skills and performance technique. It has been said that at their cores, psychology and acting attempt to do similar things: to understand why people unconsciously or consciously behave in certain ways. Actors must have a good grasp of the inner workings of the character they must portray and the psychological skills necessary to generate and fully inhabit roles which they may not have experienced in their own lives. Psychology - in particular, psychodynamic approaches - provides a deep understanding of emotion and behavior that can help you create more richly nuanced characters and improve your acting technique. 

At each meeting we will discuss a different emotion or aspect of the human condition in the context of psychoanalytic principles that provide insight into the fundamental drives and conflicts that direct our lives.  We will examine aspects of the human behaviors and attempt to relate them to character-building frameworks such as Uta Hagen’s Nine Questions, imaginative approaches such as Stella Adler's method, and conceptual frameworks such as Freud’s model of the mind. We'll share and examine our own experiences and gain insights into our behaviors and those around us. These insights, and your ability to creatively adapt them, can improve your ability to build realistic and unique characters and help you be more comfortable, charismatic, and confident in your auditions and roles. 

Please note these workshops are  best suited for actors, screenwriters, and performing artists and are not intended for psychology professionals.

Examples of topics we will cover in individual workshops:

* Greed

* Anxiety

* Jealousy

* Depression

* Grief

* Addiction

* Stage self vs. Real Self 

About the Organizer: Actors' Psychology Workshops founder Dr. Matthew Paldy has taught at colleges in New York City and Rhode Island, developed the Critical Thinking Program for the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, and served as a consultant to the NYC Department of Education's iLearnNYC Program. Dr. Paldy earned a B.S. in mathematics from the University of Massachusetts, an M.S. from Stony Brook University, and Ph.D from the University of Rhode Island.
results.name: Actors' Psychology Workshops

results.description:
Hi everyone! I have been living in Astoria since 2012, and love it! And while I have many friends who live in other parts of the city, I'd love to meet more people within the immediate area.  I imagine there are many other Astorians out there who feel the same way.  As they say... 'Why Leave Astoria?'  ;-)

Most outings will occur within the confines of Astoria, and they will be 'eclectic'. (Only occasionally will I suggest an event outside of Astoria...)  Another feature of this group is that events will be limited to 10 or so people at a time. I want people to truly get to know each other...to have good conversation...I don't want this to feel like a networking/pickup-y/name-tag kind of group. 

Our group (whose  events will be purposefully small in size) is not like other Meetup groups where you can feel anonymous.  Not showing up for events of this size does affect the host and other attendees.  I understand that things happen.  All I ask is that if you can no longer attend, or have a strong sense you will be held up at work or with family issues, that you give me Two Hours notice.  Anyone who simply does not show up or give me sufficient notice that they can no longer make the event (or else who doesn't provide a damn good explanation and profuse apology after the fact ....lol), will have to be removed from the group..  I don't do this to be a taskmaster or anything...it's just very disheartening for me to pay Meetup Organizer dues,  arrange events, provide very detailed information on events to the group, and then for me to arrive at the venue, only to find a bunch of no-shows.  All I ask is for common courtesy.  If you're not prepared to give me that, that you shouldn't join this group.  ;-)  Thank you for your understanding!

Every so often I will arrange for a somewhat larger outing, once I feel that enough good relationships have been created between members of the group.

'YES' to:

- members that are engaging, who have a positive energy, with varied interests, and who are comfortable meeting new people and diving right into conversation!

- members who understand our events will generally be small and intimate, and that communicating to the host if you can no longer attend, is expected.   

- events where we support and enjoy both the new AND the old-school establishments of Astoria. (I think it's hugely important to support the small businesses that have been in Astoria for more than a few years, and which seem to be gradually disappearing due to rent increases, etc,)

'NO to:

- joining this group with the sole purpose of hoping to fill that romantic void in your life.  (I prefer members who already consider their lives full and engaging versus people who come to events, scope out the attendees, decide there's no one that 'interests' them, and then they disengage from the group.)  There are plenty of other 'singles' Meetup groups if that's your area of focus.

- joining this group because you see all Meetup members as potential clients for your business, product, etc.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

I find groups most interesting when they have a good mix of members (singles/couples, straight/gay, younger/older, etc.,) so no one should think this group might not be for them!  I'd like to have members who've already figured out that you can be good friends with people who have different backgrounds from you, different political views, economic backgrounds, much older/younger than you, etc.  What matters most is that we all are people with positive energy, and respect each others' viewpoints.  

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

NOTE:  To help offset the fees that I must pay to Meetup.com each month as a Group Organizer, I'd like to kindly ask for a $3 donation from each member, whenever they attend one of our events.  Thank you!

Thanks for your interest, and hope to see you soon!
results.name: Eclectic Astorians

Our objective is to provide a co-learning environment where specific IT related questions can be asked and proper responses are presented. We aim to guide and mentor aspiring ICT professionals. Furthermore, we intend to: 

- foster collaboration between ICT professionals living on the African continent and those in the diaspora

 - organize Tech Meet-Ups

- have hackathons and code retreats 

- attract underrepresented groups (minority and/or women in low-income communities)

-  advocate for public and private sectors in devising impactful ICT investment plans

The group is open to anyone interested in sharing knowledge and learning more about technology and how it impacts the African Diaspora.

results.description:
Join me as I work toward building a world that lessens suffering for all, and not simply use the world to lessen my own suffering. It is through applying oneself, that one becomes, and it is in the struggle to have ones existence confirmed, and validated that we discover love; the only thing that gives life meaning, beyond which, life is absurd.

Members of “Team Good Guys”, should want for others, what they want for themselves; to be able to think critically, to be empowered with knowledge, and to have opportunities to apply that knowledge; without both, the other is useless; and lastly, “Team Good Guys”, wants to be surrounded by others who encourage, and support them to live in the “Spirit of Goodness”.

The world was built in the “Spirit of Goodness”, and anything that is the antithesis of “goodness” annihilates existence. “Goodness” leads us toward love; the confirmation, and validation of existence.

Members of “Team Good Guys” are empowered persons; they don’t sacrifice others to themselves, or sacrifice themselves to others. As such, they do not allow others to sacrifice them. In life, we cannot ask for respect, and we cannot demand it; we must command it! Being a member of “Team Good Guys” means that you have to cultivate, and maintain yourself in “The Spirit of Goodness”.

Our ultimate goal is to spend time with children who have cancer, and interact with them, without reflecting their cancer back to them.

This group requires membership dues, and is fee-based, because I want you to invest in this group, and what we are doing. If you value something that someone is doing, you will reward that person. Fees paid also serve to motivation for me to be more creative, and put forth more effort to give you your monies worth, because I know that someone wants the service. This also compels you to be more attentive to me as you expect your monies worth.

I am not in the business of collecting members. If you are in the business of playing games, don't waste my time, and test my patience. Don't waste your time. Behave with purpose, go places, do things, and meet others. I want you to value yourself. Join me, and let's work to make this group great, for everyone! See you soon...
results.name: Team Good Guys Volunteers

results.description:
Women’s Master Mind Group was designed for successful businesswomen looking to surround themselves with like-minded women. It’s a group specifically designed for women who are looking to network with other successful professionals in order to grow their business.

The Power of Successful Women Working Together Results in More Powerful Women Working   

Women’s Master Mind Group invites you to join us twice a month to discuss your strategies and success in business. We will discuss what to do, and more importantly, what not to do. Inside tips and information will be an invaluable resource for everyone to walk away with at each meeting.

It will be a “meet and greet and listen and learn” experience for all. With expert advice from your peers, these meetings can help you take your business to the next level. Whether you are an aspiring entrepreneur, long-time business owner, or looking to diversify your business, you will become empowered with the knowledge you need by attending our monthly meetings and out bi-monthly networking sessions.

Our group is open to women who earn $100,000 or more a year, and for those looking to gain knowledge on acquiring new clients or customers through networking with similar-thinking people. Our first meeting will be a huge networking event. We plan to offer a networking event every other month after that. We encourage you to bring a friend or friend’s to help build a positive circle of sisterhood consisting of other professional business women.

Women’s Master Mind Group is the first of its kind! We are looking for true professionals who can put their differences aside and participate in genuinely helping each other to succeed. There are no egos in this group, so please check them at the door as you enter! Looks, race, social background, or educational background are never the agenda. Working together to market, network, and grow your business is what our group is all about!

Are You Ready To Become Even More Successful?

After attending each meeting, you are guaranteed to walk away with knowledge that you need to help you succeed. It may be cliché, but the power of positive thinking will always help you to attain your goals, no matter how lofty they may seem. Learn to be positive and to see yourself in an even more successful environment. Once you set your mind to achieve your goals, nothing will be impossible. Women working together in a synergistic environment can only produce positive results! Are you ready!

results.description:
Foods + Friends = The Good Life

Families and friends have been sitting down to enjoy meals together for decades. However, this tradition is quickly fading in today’s society. Social media, busy schedule and work life, quick and efficient fast food and take-out dinners in front of the television all lack the face-to-face interactions that are therapeutic. Research has shown that sitting down at the table with friends for a meal is enjoyable, fun, and may even improve our health! Bonds are reaffirmed, stress is relieved, level of happiness increased and depression alleviated.

One of the most wonderful things about New York City is its melting pot of ethnicities and its incredible ethnic diversity identity. Exploring different ethnic neighborhoods and sampling their delicious ethnic foods is a must, whether you live in NYC or are just visiting. Eating in an ethnic restaurant is about more than just the food, it’s a cultural experience that gives you a literal taste of life in another land.

If you enjoy dining on good food, meet new people, discover new restaurants and cuisines, come join us and together we will eat our way through a cornucopia of exotic cuisines representing all corners of the globe. Do all of this in a fun, relaxed setting with other adventurous eaters just like yourself!

MEETUP FEE:  To help defray the cost of paying Meetup HQ to keep the site up and running, a $1.00 Meetup fee will be collected at randomly selected events.

IMPORTANT GROUP RULES: A successful group is not about how many members there are in the group. It is about the quality of members in the group! We would rather have a small group of "quality members" than a huge group of "joiners" and “lurkers” who never show up to any event.

With that said:

(1) To join the group, you must have a recognizable face picture; and

(2) Being a member in the group, you don’t have to attend every event on the calendar, but try to participate in at least 1 event every few months. If you are a general lurker who join the group but not participate in any event, please don’t bother to join.

General rsvp policy:

Yes rsvps ONLY if you are serious about attending an event. No need to rsvp if not attending.

We will enforce a strict ANTI-FLAKE POLICY - Just one (1) no-show or last minute (less than 24 hours) cancel will get you booted out of the group.

If you are an RSVP-aholic, that is, you rsvp to every single event and then bail out last minute, you don't belong in this group and are NOT welcome.
results.name: NYC Ethnic Eats

results.description:
Women encouraging and helping other women to get strong and lift heavy -- it's that simple.

Ever looked at a barbell and wanted to use it, but got too nervous? Didn't know proper form? Wasn't sure if it was for you? Didn't want to "get too big?" Felt uncomfortable trying without a spotter?

I was there. With some exercises, I am *still* there, but the greatest resource we sister lifters, new and old, have out there are each other. I figure the best people to learn from, and the best folk to encourage to start are women in NYC who are willing to learn and to give back to new ladies who want to learn the ropes of heavy compound lifting (squats, deadlifts, bench presses, power lifting moves -- i.e. clean and jerk, etc).

Not limited to just barbell work, I'd like this to be a space where women can find spotters, create work out groups, attend boot camps, offer to be at a gym for a certain period of time so that others looking to start can reach out and have a contact that first day they step into a gym. Welcome sisters! Let's help each other build ourselves up.

results.description: KRAV MAGA is a Self Defense system developed for the military in Israel that consist of a wide combination of practical techniques and realistic training scenarios. Ideas in Krav Maga include: Counterattacking as soon as possible (or attacking pre-emptively). Targeting attacks to the body's most vulnerable points. Maximum effectiveness and efficiency in order to neutralize the opponent as quickly as possible. Maintaining awareness of surroundings while dealing with the threat. Learning to understand the psychology of a street confrontation, and identifying potential threats before an attack occurs This meetup group is for anyone who would like to learn Krav Maga. We can get together to learn Self Defense against any real world dangers and counter in the quickest and most efficient way. The intensity of these workouts will keep you physically fit, develop awareness and build confidence over time. I have asked a friend, David Ordini to show us some of the basics of Krav Maga. We can meetup once a week and learn self defense from a 9 year Krav Maga student who studied under the grand master. So come and join us at our next meetup, learn self defense, meet some new people and have fun.

results.description:
Ever since its release last spring, the NativeScript runtime has generated a great deal of buzz throughout the development community, and for good reason. In honor of its inception, this summer has been deemed the Summer of NativeScript! With the release of NativeScript, web engineers can translate their skills into the mobile frontier, so don't miss out on your chance to get hands-on experience with this powerful runtime! 

Telerik's Summer of NativeScript campaign has been sweeping the globe throughout the past few months. During July, attendees learned about the basics of the NativeScript Runtime - Those attending a Summer of NativeScript meet-up in August will be going beyond the basics of the runtime. Those who will be attending Summer of NativeScript in September will get the most detailed, and complex look at the runtime as the Telerik team has spent the summer curating videos, powerpoints, and detailed labs which can be custom tailored to your applications needs. That said, Telerik gives us the opportunity to hold three different meet-ups, where you will gain an extremely high-level perspective of the NativeScript runtime; however, if demand for this meet-up is low, we will be forced to condense it into one meet-up, which will be a deep-dive on NativeScript.


The time and place of NYC's Summer of NativeScript meet-ups will be announced in the upcoming weeks, so be sure to join to stay updated on any new information! 


Below, I have attached the material used thus far for Summer of NativeScript meet-ups. This material has been provided by Telerik. 


Meetup #1: Welcome to NativeScript

The first meetup is all about introducing NativeScript. The slides explain what NativeScript is and how to build apps with it. The hands-on lab walks you through the basics of starting an app and making changes to it.

Slides

• PowerPoint

• PDF

Video

• YouTube

Lab

• Instructions


Meetup #2: Beyond the Basics

The second meetup is about going about the basics with NativeScript. The slides explain concepts like navigation, data binding, CSS, and more—then the hands-on lab walk you through adding these features to a real app.

Slides

• PowerPoint

• PDF

Video

Lab

Meetup #3: Diving Deep

Slides

Lab

results.description:
This is a group for those who like Blues, Country & Gospel Music. "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!" are a unique entity in the NY/NJ music scene. They consider themselves the only guitar/vocal duo that mixes equal parts Rockabilly, Country and genuine guitar Gospel music with a spoonful of greasy Blues to wash it all down. Their influences include many seminal figures in American music, such as Hank Williams, Elvis Presley, Chuck Berry, Gene Vincent, Reverend Charlie Jackson, Howlin' Wolf, Wilbert Harrison, Arthur “Big Boy” Crudup, Sister Rosetta Tharpe, Brother Joe May, Charlie Feathers, Carl Perkins, Smiley Lewis, Brother Claude Ely and Lloyd Price, among many others. Watch them bring this amazing music alive at many great New York and New Jersey clubs and venues, and meet other like-minded fans of American Roots Music. This is not your father’s blues – it’s more like your grandfather’s…if your grandfather was a preacher in a Mississippi Baptist church.

What others are saying about "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!":

"When you hit the stage, it was like we were hit with a bolt of lightning! Truly electrifying! Really brought the place to life! You guys owned the stage like few have at The Way Station." - James Coyle

"These guys are amazing. The closest thing to Hank Williams Sr. this side of Heaven." - Jim Chum

"Together Gary Van Miert and Malcolm Marsden form the Sensational Country Blues Wonders, one of the best throwback blues groups on any side of the Hudson -- and quite likely good enough to swell with the Mississippi." - The Jersey Journal

"These guys are the real musical anarchists." - David Huberman

“They call it Country/Blues/Gospel, I call it.... I don't even know. If the lovechild of Carl Perkins and Hank Williams became a preacher whose church had a liquor store and an opium den, you might come close to The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!” - Valdaniel Martins

We got there and the country group “The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!” started their set. To be completely honest, country has never really been my favorite genre, but these guys TOTALLY changed my mind on country music. I absolutely loved them!! - CHICpeaJC
results.name: "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!"  Meetup Group

results.description: Lets go back in time for a bit. Back to the time when records and cassette tapes were in play, a time when simple things were fun. Remember when you used to run street light to street light? Or race your friends for fun? Oh, and field day at school. That was the best! The best times of your life. You were running fast — and it was fun. You were in the best shape of your life and didn't even realize it. Now flash forward. Those simple games filled with sprinting and fast movements have been replaced with idleness, jogging and other slow-twitch movements. It's time to change that. In fact, the only people who should perform low-intensity cardiovascular exercise like jogging are those who need to lose muscle tissue. To maximize your body composition and performance, sprinting is the modality of choice. A well-designed sprint program — that's where we come in — will significantly reduce body fat, increase work capacity and reaction time and develop your posterior chain (the fancy term for glutes and all the other muscles on the back of your leg) like that of a world-class athlete. Sprinting (yes, even now with more candles on your birthday cake) is the best thing you're not doing. A Tribe Called Sprinters is a fitness movement committed to making sprinting accessible to everyone for overall fitness and for competition.
results.name: A Tribe Called Sprinters Club

results.description: You're invited to join a group for parents with children whose behavior and learning problems suggest the possibility of Attention Deficit Disorder and/or Dyslexia. Many doctors, educators and parents express growing concern at the increasing number of young people being put on powerful medication for Attention Deficit Disorder, a condition often identified only by vague symptoms. A disproportionate number of young people are labeled and treated for A.D.D. in the U.S. compared to most other countries. This fact alarms many authorities, including law enforcement officials who now report high levels of abuse of A.D.D. and A.D.H.D.-related, prescribed drugs. Join us if your child: 1) Works slow, 2) Avoids reading, 3) Skips over words, 4) Reverses letters, or 5) Has poor reading comprehension.

results.description: I recently lost my mother very suddenly, and have been surprised at how even NYC doesn't offer a support group for young adults who have lost a parent. While there are plenty of groups for kids and teens, older adults and even parentless parents, the "young adult" age range has been highly overlooked by bereavement support groups. Meanwhile, I have found it hard to relate to both people who lost parents in their teens or middle age; on the one hand, I had an adult relationship with my mother, but I also feel she will never get to see me finish "growing up" completely. On top of that, young adults are often living the most transitional, independent portions of their lives. Most of us here in NYC live away from family and our oldest friends, we are building careers, still figuring out who we are, experiencing the dizzying ups and downs of dating, and living in impermanent homes either alone or with strangers. My goal is to create a group who knows what it's like to be amidst the chaotic flows of young adult life while grieving the loss of a parent. This group is not so much based on age as it is what stage of life you feel you are in. If the above resonates with you, you are more than welcome to join. It does not matter how you lost your parent, or even if you are simply coping with a sick parent whom is still alive. Meetings will be casual, simple, fun, and relaxing -- a picnic at the park, a cool little restaurant, a warm bar, etc., and I strongly encourage all members to make suggestions. I just want to meet some new friends who are also figuring out how to live a good life under the heavy weight of grief, to hang out and heal in good company.
results.name: Young Adults Who Have Lost a Parent

results.description:
This is a social network for professional lesbians in the tri-state age range is 35 plus. Many know me as running the professional women's party Qgirls for many years.   I had an 'aha' moment of sorts as I wondered to myself as a newly single 40 something woman in the city why is it that I don't feel a sense of community.

We need to interconnect with one another and create our unity.  This group is not political nor is it a business.   This is about pure and simple connecting.  Speaking for me in my life most of my friends are coupled off and nesting.  I wished there was a safe place where folks could go on and post a fun idea or happening that they just didn't want to participate in by themselves.

I decided to take matters into my own hand and try to change the design of our scenery a bit.  I am hoping there are other women who feel the way I do. There are a lot of fun events to plan and things to do that would be so much more fun and rewarding doing with others.  I'm eager to meet and get to know other gay women on a deeper level than just saying hello when entering a party. 

We all know the old adage....lovers come and go but friends last forever.  Well I want it to be we can or don't have lovers but how full will our lives be with a REAL, GENUINE, DEPENDABLE social circle available to us.

Come join me in this journey and let's make Qgirls connections the destination for all professional women who are in search of friendship and support. 

I look forward to meeting you.

Cheers, Heather
results.name: Qgirl Connections - Social Network of Professional Lesbians

results.description:
Meet Up's Purpose: 

***Meet ups and events will take place throughout New York rotating primarily between Nassau County, Brooklyn, and Manhattan.***

Taking our inspiration from bell hooks and her book "Sisters Of The Yam: Black Women And Self-Recovery", we come together to celebrate each other and ourselves. We come together with the understanding that having a community of like-minded sisters can foster self-recovery, self-actualization, and continued healing. 

Members should expect to have fun, share, learn, and explore. We are building a community for support, healing, continued survival, and necessary change. Get ready for support, growth, and more. We will enjoy nights out, picnics, museum trips, cultural performances, dance classes, yoga sessions, meditation workshops, a book club, volunteering opportunities, and more exciting and healing adventures. 

“I mostly want to remind her of the recipes of healing, and give her my own made-on-the spot remedy for the easing of her pain. I tell her, “Get a pen. Stop crying so you can write this down and start working on it tonight.” My remedy is long. But the last item on the list says: “When you wake up and find yourself living someplace where there is nobody you love and trust, no community, it is time to leave town – to pack up and go (you can even go tonight). And where you need to go is any place where there are arms that can hold you, that will not let you go.” 
― Bell Hooks, Sisters of the Yam: Black Women and Self-Recovery


Who Should Join:

Like-minded Women Of Color

Why You Should Join:

Sisters Of The Yam is a space in which we can learn to take care of ourselves and each other. 

June Jordan in “Where is the love?” 1978

“I am a feminist, and what that means to me is much the same as the meaning of the fact that I am Black: it means that I must undertake to love myself and to respect myself as though my very life depends upon self-love and self-respect. It means that I must everlastingly seek to cleanse myself of the hatred and the contempt that surrounds and permeates my identity, as a woman, and as a Black human being, in this particular world of ours.”

Shanesha Brooks-Tatum in “Subversive Self-Care: Centering Black Women’s Wellness,” 2012

“Black women’s self-care is also subversive because to take care of ourselves means that we disrupt societal and political paradigms that say that Black women are disposable, unvalued. Indeed, people and things that aren’t cared for are considered expendable. So when we don’t take care of ourselves, we are affirming the social order that says black women are disposable.”
results.name: Sisters Of The Yam - NY

results.description:
Welcome to NYC Beach Bums! 

Our meetup group is dedicated to get all the beach loving people of NYC to our events at Rockaway Beach and other NYC beaches this summer and start of fall. 

If you love to just chill on the beach with your friends, or if your a novice or an experienced boarder looking for a cool way to meet new people and have a great time then this club is for you.  

We offer a summer, & fall season club membership which includes regularly scheduled events to Rockaway Beach, and when the swells arrive we'll be posting events at Gilgo Beach and Ditch Plains! Later in the fall we'll be announcing some overnight trips to camp out and go surfing in Montauk right on the beach! 

The club has it's own 14 passenger van for transporting our members to our events and is outfitted with a custom roof rack to carry any type of gear to our events so bring your boards, coolers, couches, koozies... and whatever else you need!

We have a love for the Rockaway's and have been surfing there for over 20 years. It would be our pleasure to be your Rockaway sherpa and put you on to all the cool destination beaches there and the local hot spots to grab some of the best food, adult beverages, and parties in NYC right by the beach. 

Once the surf season is over we also run a meetup called NYC Go Wild Outdoor Club which runs from October - April and will be hosting trips up to some of the coolest parts of the Catskills and go to hidden swim holes, hiking, tubing, kayaking, camping, fishing, and throwing down some kick ass bbq's in the middle of nature. 

This is a real deal club and we're looking for a solid crew of members to have an awesome time with!

Looking forward to meeting you all!

Mahalo from your friends at NYC Beach Bums

Call us with any questions you may have 1.347.931.1600
results.name: NYC Beach Bums

We pray for each other and as a group we pray for our spiritual growth and holiness. We forgive, we love, we embrace, we pray and we don't judge. Our goal is keeping the fire of our Lord blazing in our souls and make sure we are helping each other on the road to Heaven. Spiritual talks will be held from time to time. Come, let us pray together We need each other. Heaven is the house of God's family, be one. Love you all.

results.description: This group is for adult only children who are looking for close friendships with others who can commiserate with the specific loneliness of being an only child. It gets harder to make new and close friends in your late 20s and 30s and many of my friends have become closer to their siblings and/or spouses as a result. I want to create a community of similarly situated individuals who lack a built in peer support network and who are open to creating close friendships. Let's share in new life milestones, the anxiety of having the aging or geographically distant parents, or just brunches, late night drinks and pep talks or whatever else it is that siblings do for each other.

results.description: This ballroom dance meetup group will especially target those wallflowers who are self conscious due to feeling like they have two left feet. This goes for both men and women.  Men, if you are hesitant to put yourself out there, rest assured that, if you know how to dance, women will melt in your arms.  Even if your greatest fear is to simply put yourself out there to be seen by others when taking ballroom dancing lessons, rest assured that you will find comrades who are in the exact same position that your are, and who will not judge you based on your skill level. And by golly gee, you will be astounded by the alleviation of stress that this dynamic yet relaxed atmosphere will provide. In addition, if you fear the intimidation that some teachers can very well evoke, rest assured that Don is quite encouraging by focusing on what you have done right, as opposed to criticizing you for what you have done wrong. Thus, you will learn to dance with confidence. Not only will you look great, but you'll feel comfortable on the dance floor.
results.name: ballroom dancing for very beginners

results.description: You are a creative being, you're just not a consistent one. Schedules and deadlines sap your inspiration, and it really bums you out that most creative success requires consistency! Come and join together with fellow creatives that feel your pain. There will be guest speakers, group activities and the chance to create some low-pressure accountability around your creative projects.
results.name: Inconsistent Creatives Meetup

results.description:
A few weeks ago I decided to move and for the first time live with a roommate. I thought to myself, maybe I should try Craigslist. The moment I started to comb through Craigslist for a roommate I got overwhelmed and simply gave up. I couldn't tell who was authentic or who was a bot. The first emails I sent left me bombarded with spam. 

I tried two other sites that I will not mention here because it is not important but they could not deliver what I was expecting. Plus, the ritual of going back and forth instead of simply meeting and deciding within a short time and move on with my live was taking too much time. The frustration got to me and if you are here I believe you share this frustration. I have good news for you however. We can take the reins and take back control. Who says we need a third party to find you a roommate. 

This meetup will serve to find to find, professionals like yourself,  a roommate that meets your expectations. The success of this meetup will be in direct correlation to your commitment in showing up and participating. Basically, do not waste my time as I will not waster yours. 

The format of the meetup will be the same each week and will be as follows: 

1. Pre-populated Questionnaire – You will only have to do this once and given that your criteria for a roommate does not change you won’t have to do this ever again 

2. First 10 minutes - Chat or mingle or whatever you New Yorkers want to call it. 

3. Then 20 minutes of "algorithmically" matching you up with a roommate. Basically, I will use the information from the questionnaire to match you up with a few people and you get to decide if you want to talk with this person or not. 

4. Then another 25 minutes of you walking over and talking to someone that you think might be a great roommate. 

5. 5 minutes wrap up. You get to hear the success stories of people who found their roommate for that session.
results.name: Roommate Matchup for Professionals - New York City

results.description: There are many great women's cycling groups in NYC, but this one will focus on the LBTQ community. We'll plan weekly trips of varying lengths (depending on interest) and usually work in a snack or lunch stop along the way.

results.description: This group is specifically for Bar Exam Repeat Test Takers to start the healing process and prepare to take the Bar Exam again. Only a repeat test taker knows what feels like to experience this specific kind of public failure. Let me help you start the process of healing your mind and spirit by strengthening your resolve to conquer the Bar Exam once and for all ! Join us to discuss concrete strategies, tips, and practical methods that work.
results.name: Bar Exam Repeat Test Takers Seminar

results.description: This group is comprised of a community of individuals who are dedicated to improving their resume building skills, and learning strategies to employ before, during, and after their job interviews. Learn about unique tactics that will get you noticed and help you obtain the job of your dreams! This is one Meet-up group you need to be a part of! —Join us!  Make the affordable investment in yourself by sharpening your skills through networking with and sharing with others.
results.name: Resume and Job Search Strategies and Tactics

results.description: This is Daniel Jordano, actor and author of the humbly titled: "The Best Book on Acting: How to Become a Better Actor Instantly Without Killing Yourself with the Method" If you are an actor, you've probably done your fair share of pointless exercises in classes: "Hold the imaginary teacup. Feel the warmth of the tea. Can you smell it? Can you smell it?" ...or you may have had your fill of "gurus" who may direct scenes, but don't give actors any understanding of how to get where they need to get--on their own! Well we are launching a NEW workshop on Sept. 24th called “The Life Acting Workshop” where we don't have any gurus. We focus on each member putting up work in an atmosphere of helping one another using a simple and effective system called …LIFE ACTING...with an emphasis on ON CAMERA work. Life Acting is summed up in the question: “What does your character want from the other actors/characters and how are you going to get it? At the current time, we are limited to 10 committed actors. The experience level is not the key issue here, but the willingness to make a commitment to the work. Each workshop is only $25. The initial one will take place from 7pm to 10pm on Thursday, September 24th My goal for this is to develop an encouraging and safe place to work and improve our craft as actors. I am serving as the facilitator. Not a guru. We will learn and be encouraged by ONE ANOTHER!
results.name: The Life Acting Workshop

results.description:
Write, Speak, and Teach is a meetup to create momentum for its members to create and ship great content.

If you are a writer, speaker, or teacher (or an author, podcaster, coach, or trainer) you need to get the word out about your work. Content marketing is the best way to get the word out and build your platform.

Content marketing means creating great content, in multiple formats, and then engaging with others about the content, in ways that creates more content, which builds your brand and visibility. 

In the process of creating content, your best effort and a deadline should be the goal, not perfection. 

Lets come together as a group in fun interactive ways, to learn, to take on the challenge of disciplined content creation, and to create momentum for ourselves and each other. 

This group requests member dues because we meet in NYC at a cool interactive space, which costs decent money.

Our first meetup will be a "Launch Some Work" challenge to get the ball rolling.

"Create and ship... create and ship..."
results.name: Write, Speak & Teach - Platform Builders Meetup

topics.name: Single Parents, Divorced Parents, Widowed Parents

results.description: We are a social group for LGBTQ Single Parents. Whether you are single by choice, divorce, or widowhood, this is a place for us to get together, socialize, share resources, and be proud of who we are. Whether you are a parent through biology, adoption, Donor Egg/Sperm, Surrogacy or Fostering, let's connect! Maybe you have been out since you were 12. Maybe you are just coming out. Either way, you are all included. Maybe you are just thinking of becoming a single LGBT parent, or perhaps you are already in the midst of trying and need encouragement and advice. All are welcome. All gender identities and queer sexual orientations are included. We meet in kid friendly spaces so we don't have to get babysitters. We go to the Gay Center Family Play Day together so we are not the only single parents there. We meet for a picnic in the park, or even sometimes go out for a night on the town. Let's unite! Get to know each other! Share struggles and celebrate our triumphs! We are amazing and we should all know each other!
results.name: LGBTQ Single Parents of New York City

results.description: I'm creating this group for women between the ages of 25 to 47 who love living and socializing in Brooklyn and want to make good friendships along the way. I really want this to be a space where women can bond over drinks and inevitably make friendships outside of meetup. So whether you grew up in Brooklyn or are new to this great borough - feel free to join! Im open to meetup suggestions but for now I'm just guaging interest level. I'm limiting the number of people in this group as I want to attract people who are serious about attending regularly, so again, this is a space where you can develop real friendships. If you have been inactive for 4 months or longer than I will likely remove you from the group. Thanks!

We'll get together for fun, informal (but incredibly interesting) gatherings to share all we know with each other.

results.description: I started a book club almost 2 years ago (October, 2013) with a small group of friends/family either living or working in NYC via an email distro and we're still going strong almost 2 years later. I wanted to start a meet up group in an effort to get more, new, exciting, different members to join! This book club meets once a month (we aim for the 2nd tuesday of each month, but it does change from time to time based on the availability of the sub-group of people interested in attending each month. This book club is super chill - come whenever you can come type of thing. We tend to meet at restaurants/cafes or at someone's apartment if they are able to host. There is no theme in terms of types of books we choose for the book club - I choose books for the the first half of the year and second half of the year ahead of time so that you know which books are in the pipeline/can decide which book to reach for the corresponding month. We have had so much fun and so many interesting discussions over the past 2 years - we would love to have you JOIN!!
results.name: NYC Chill/Anything goes/No themed Book Club!

results.description: A unique combination of martial arts and body movement, a moving meditation, that cultivates the spirit along with the mind and body, Shintaido means "new body way." Shintaido forms exemplify openness and freedom, providing a new way of experiencing our relationship with ourselves, others, nature, and the spiritual world. Explore this healing martial/meditative art and form in its natural dojo - outdoors in some of the finest landscapes in NYC.
results.name: Shintaido NYC Meetup

results.description:
This meetup is for people who enjoy playing music in collaboration with others but haven't found a group of other musicians that actually understand each other when it comes to composition and find it impossible to meetup regularly. If you love to jam along with like minded people who are open to all kinds of music including but not limited to 90's rock, grunge, alternative, soft rock, reggae, and jazz then this group is for you. Whether you are a singer, guitarist (lead or rhythm), drummer, base player, pianist, or love to play the Ukulele then you are welcome to play along. Every week I intend on dedicating at least 1 day to getting together and playing a specific song that (as a team) we can master and record with the goal of making an album and eventually becoming a unified band.

At first, I wont expect much but to get to know everyone and see how well we can work together as a team. Then once we get the hang of things we should move as quickly as possible in the time allotted. I expect people to have a general idea of how to read music, tablature, play in key, and be at least a beginner to intermediate player. I still have much to learn but as a team we should help eachother as much as possible to succeed.

When we meetup, expect to:

-Practice, Practice, Practice on your own time

-Discuss different ways to compose a song

-Work on weaknesses and utilize our strengths

-Learn and develop with music production software (I still have much to learn as well)

-Play cover songs and songs we create as well

-Record music

-Expect criticism (in other words- tough love)

-And most of all, have fun

I will be updating our future events the coming week and will outline the details as we go. If you have any questions comments or concern please feel free to message me personally or comment on our page.

Thank you for your patience.

**NOTICE FOR Ultimate Frisbee players**

Due to the change of the season, the ultimate Frisbee meetups will no longer be held until next summer. Sorry if this has been an inconvenience. For those who have joined the Lets Make a Band! meetup, I may have some information of my previous meetup (such as pictures and commnets) please don't mind them as I will be adding photos of our new endeavors!
results.name: Lets Make a Band!

Our dealers and players are happy to teach/coach beginners. For those shy to play casino games, we have chess and other table games available! 

Come make new friends and learn or improve your card playing skills with us! Look forward to meeting you all!!!

results.description: Spreading the art of Kathak with our pholisophy - " Art is a bridge to the values of life ". To impart training mainly in the field of Indian Classical Dance Kathak and other associated Indian Classical Performing Arts / Disciplines like vocal, music, harmonium, sitar, percussion and other classical and folk dance forms, yoga, etc. To inculcate Indian values of life amongst the masses, more particularly the younger generation through the Guru-Shishya Parampara – leading to a direct interaction of the teacher and the student, making the relation special and personal. The purpose of training is not only to produce talented artists but also to pass on the true Indian culture and values amongst the students as well as their family members and the society at large. To cultivate and enhance the interest in dance and other performing arts highlighting that they are not only the medium of entertainment but also a medium for proper channelization of emotions as this plays a vital role in determining the quality of life. Balanced growth of physique, mind and spirit/soul/emotions helps in developing fundamental moral values. Learning an art form also makes one more receptive, sensitive and helps in the development of one’s aesthetic nature. This outlook helps a person to work not only for oneself but also for society at large and thus the masses are benefited. To organize workshops, lecture-demonstrations and Meets with prominent artists & Gurus, with an aim to nurture and further develop the participants interest and give the participants a platform to interact with the senior artists and Gurus and learn from them directly. To produce or arrange for productions and choreographies for presentation in various festivals, programmes and communication media. To work for development and advancement of dance, music and other performing arts and to set up and maintain Educational Institute and Research Center in these fields.
results.name: Edison Kathak with Guru Shila Mehta's Nupur Zankar

results.description:
Welcome to Go Wild NYC! 

Our meetup group is dedicated to all the outdoor adventure loving people of NYC to experience a kick ass lineup of events in the state parks and private campgrounds surrounding the Hudson Valley and the Catskills. 

From October - April we'll be hosting a regular schedule of day trips, and multi day trips to some of the most beautiful New York State Parks and natural wonders to explore the outdoors and all it has to offer. 

In the winter season we'll be hosting as many trips as possible up to the mountains as well for our NYC Snow Bums to hit the slopes upstate and in Vermont. 


Our Trips Include

Waterfall & Nature Hikes
Swimming Holes
Delaware River Tubing
Camping January - April
Snowboarding
Skiing

Whether you want to just kick back in one of the beautiful state parks with your friends to BBQ and party with the local wildlife, or if your a novice or an experienced skier or boarder looking for a quick staycay and a cool way to meet new people to have a great time then this club is for you. 


The club has it's own 14 passenger van for transporting our members to our events and is outfitted with a custom roof rack to carry any type of gear to our events so bring your boards, coolers, couches, koozies... and whatever else you need!

We have a deeply rooted love for the Catskill's and Hudson Valley area's and have been exploring there for over 20 years. 

It would be our pleasure to be your sherpa. Once the fall and winter season are over we also run a membership club and meetup called NYC Beach Bums which runs from May - September and will be hosting regular trips up to some of the coolest beached in New York like the Rockaway's, Gilgo Beach, and Ditch Plains.

This is a real deal club and we're looking for a solid crew of members to have an awesome time with! Looking forward to meeting you all!

Love and Peace from your friends at Go Wild NYC!
results.name: Go Wild NYC Outdoor Club

results.description: Meeting up to hear someone talk about new tech and their startup journey is great. I do it all the time. But we want less talk and more playing with new stuff - new tech stuff. We'll invite featured guests with newly launched or nearly launched tech products and services to give us a hands-on demo. Let's play with new tech. Let's play games. Let's mess with a SaaS. Let's download some new apps. And most importantly, let's give feedback. It's the lifeblood of a startup. We can all benefit from each other's experience. And we can all have some great fun discovering new tech. Bring your smartphone, tablet, and/or computer. Or look on with someone else. If you want to be featured as a new or upcoming technology for us to play with at one of our meetups, contact the organizer.
results.name: New York Plays with New Tech

results.description: New York is a truly interesting place. There are so many things going and it is easy to get caught up with our daily life. But when we pause and look around, we see a lot of poverty and brokenness along with some extravagance. Obviously we can't fix everything, but we can be part of solution! I think being able to serve and help less fortunate is a privilege and rewarding experience. This group is for any youngsters who are passionate about helping others :) We will also have some opportunity to get to know each other after each event. Hope you join this FUN group!

results.description:
Folks in the vicinity of Spyten Duyvil, Riverdale, and Kingsbridge, sections of the Bronx, or Inwood section of Manhttan, or anybody who is willing to travel to these areas.

If your tired of being overweight, outta shape, and wishing to be thin again and need all motivation in the world, say to your self; "Let's do it ! , and be all in, totally committed no matter what the weather is , or how tired and unmotivated you are or how too early it may be.

Here's a little about me. All my life I was a skinny in shape person (134 lbs). Ten years ago injured my feet and could no longer run. I would lay on a couch from the minute I came home from work until I had to go back. Im now 49 years old, 209 lbs and round. I have my foot pain under control for about 2 years now, and desire to run again. I love exercising (PT) in groups like when I was in the Army. So here is what I want to do:

I figure after the summer is over and everybody goes back to work, I would like to start a morning exercise (PT) group, that would meet, Monday thru Saturday in the morning. We will start very slow, super duper slow, and over the course of time build ourselves up and lose weight at the same time.

We motivate each other and as we do it each day, and as time goes by it will become easier and feel less awkward. Like the lottery, you got to be in it to win it.

Here are a few ideas that I have as I live in Spyten Duyvil. We can either meet in Van Cortland Park, Inwood Park or at the base of the Henry Hudson Bridge and make our way over to Inwood park. Or we can do Palisades Ave for a very slow start and build up over time to a full throttle. Everyday begins and ends with a full stretch session.

I hope to here from you
results.name: Back to Basics, Army PT Group

results.description:
The Brooklyn HubSpot User Group (HUG) is a community of Inbound marketing professionals and business owners. Some of us have been using HubSpot for years, some of us run marketing agencies, and some are just starting to learn about Inbound. If you love networking and exploring new ways to grow your business, join us for a meetup!

Do I have to be a HubSpot User?

Nope! In addition to current users, we welcome anyone interested in learning more about HubSpot or Inbound Marketing in general. That said, our agenda will typically include a deep-dive into some aspect of the HubSpot tools, or a customer case study.

Is this Going to be a Sales Pitch?

No! The sole purpose of a HUG is to get together and learn the best of HubSpot from one another. A basic tenet of Inbound Marketing is understanding that people hate being sold to. We earn trust through education.

What's a Typical HUG Agenda Like?

All HubSpot user groups follow a similar agenda, which includes networking, an educational presentation, and a group discussion. At least twice each year we'll also have guest speakers from HubSpot headquarters join us! Our meetups are casual, helpful, and provide members with complimentary food, drinks and HubSpot SWAG.

What Should I Bring to the Meet-Up?

Business cards for networking, something to take notes (Wifi will be available, if you want to bring a laptop or tablet), and an open mind for learning and sharing.

Can My Company Host a Meet-Up?

Absolutely! One of the more challenging aspects of meetup planning is finding space, so if your company can accommodate a group of 30+, let's chat. We require a location our members can get to easily via major subway lines, high-speed Wifi, a large presentation monitor (or a large screen and laptop projector), enough space for networking, and the ability to bring in food and drinks. In exchange for your hospitality, we'll include your logo and link to your site on our registration landing page, as well as social media promotion. Email bklynhug@gmail.com to start a conversation!
results.name: Brooklyn HubSpot User Group

results.description:
Welcome to Beyond Borders! We're setting out to be the largest community of 1st generation trailblazers in the world. Join us! #diasporans #myparentsareimmigrants #forgeinborn #crossculturalcommunity #trailblazer 

1st generation - VERY loosely defined as those who've migrated from their home country or were born in their parents' host country. 

This group will transcend racial, cultural, and national boundaries to bring us together in the name of shared life experiences. On a daily basis we navigate multiple worlds, languages, families, and identities beyond borders. Here, you can count on effortless fun and authentic social gatherings that enable us to bond over our journeys, share resources, anchor one another, laugh, and build intergenerational/intercultural community around the world. Just imagine, because of the community you'll have in Beyond Borders, you can be any where in the world and always have a place to call home.

Whether your journey was long ago, recently, or today as you maneuvered between your and your immigrant parents' realities, cheers to the largest energetic social community of people with your shared experience! Share this group with loved ones and encourage entire families to join.

Event types:  group 'going home' trips, remittance parties, hackathons, slam storytelling, foreign accent stand-up comedy, fundraising, speaker series, potlucks, movie nights, date nights, travel workshops, adult camp, mentorship, holiday celebrations, and podcast series.

Let's take pride and ownership of this genuine community where the unspoken language of living beyond borders bonds us. 

 See you soon. #YouAreWelcomed
results.name: Beyond Borders - 1st Generation Trailblazers!

This group is for people with love for the urban sport of handball.  Since I couldn't find a group on here for myself, I thought I'd start one up.  Although the group is open to all levels, I would like to keep the pace casual.  Let it be a group for people who just want to meet up and play; exercise, socialize, all that good stuff.  I just hit forty years old and it's difficult to find mature people to play with.  You would find that I have a deep personal attachment to the game.

  I call the group 'Wall Network' because there are walls located all over NYC and Meet Ups can happen anywhere.  I'm only organizer of this group because I started it; but my hope is that people will join, get talking, and post some friendly challenges.  You come to me; I come to  you.   I love exploring new parks and discovering their walls.  Maybe you have a cool one by you, or maybe we can all discover one together.  As it stands now, it's just me, so I guess I'll have to start by posting where i'll be and when.  Anyone's welcome to call 'Next!'

results.description: New York City isn't the easiest or friendliest place to fly RC airplanes. We don't have the luxury of wide open fields with no one around to bother. I am a member of a local aviation club, but it can take up an hour or longer each way to get there and it just isn't always practical. I like to fly small to larger airplanes as well. I've found that some respectful and cautious local flying in NYC can be possible if we really respect our surroundings and don't do stupid things. This meetup is only for RC Airplanes and unfortunately no Quadcopters or Drones. I own and enjoy some myself, but the reckless use of these had shed a negative light on the hobby and there are other groups for that. My aim is to gather some quiet, respectful and fun people to fly our planes as close to or in Manhattan without causing any issues and flying places which don't violate restrictions. I have a whole series of future events and plans that I am working on but this is a simple start.
